Module nl.naturalis.common
Package nl.naturalis.common

Class Result<T>

java.lang.Object
nl.naturalis.common.Result<T>
Type Parameters:
T - the type of the value
public final class Result<T> extends Object
Simple value container. The value is explicitly allowed to be null. This class is primarily meant to be used as the return value of methods that would otherwise return null as the result of a computation, but also if the computation yielded no result. A typical scenario would be iterating over an array and returning a particular element, if found. If the element can legitimately be null, it is not clear any longer what a returning null actually means: not present or "really" null. Using Result, you would return a Result containing null if the element was null. If the element was not present, you would return none(). Note that re-using, for example, AtomicReference for this purpose would be awkward and confusing.
